DOC.HEAD: Five Stabbed To Death, Seven Injured In Black Faction Fight
DOC.TEXT: Street fighting between rival groups near the southern town of Uitenhage left at least five black men dead and seven seriously injured, police reported today. Police said the battle Thursday was part of an ongoing feud between supporters of the United Democratic Front, a nationwide anti-apartheid coalition, and a group of ``Africanists.'' Most Africanists are aligned with the outlawed Pan Africanist Congress, which favors black self-reliance in the quest of political rights as opposed to the Front's multiracial approach. Those killed and injured ranged in age from 16 to 43 and were stabbed or suffered blows to the head during two hours of fighting in Kwanobuhle, a township outside Uitenhage, police said. The two groups have fought sporadically for political control of the area since 1987, according to the independent South Africa Press Association. The Front also is involved in a power struggle in Natal Province, where fighting with Inkatha, a relatively conservative Zulu organization, has left about 2,500 people dead over the past three years.
